p: M. charantia has medicinal value and is also used as a vegetable. The compounds present in M. charantia exert anti-diabetic, anti-cancerous and anti-tumorous, anti-microbial, anti-viral, anti-helmintic, antimalarial, anti-ulcerative and immunomodulatory activities ( Gupta et al., 2011; Kulkarni et al., 2021; Lur et al., 2021; Malik et al., 2021).
